net.hudup.core.data.ctx

Interface CTSManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Alg, AutoCloseable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CTSManagerAbstract, DefaultCTSManager

    public interface CTSManager
extends Alg, AutoCloseable
    This is a very important class which is responsible for managing contexts (Context) and context templates (ContextTemplate). In other words, CTSManager manipulates context template schema ContextTemplateSchema and its instances. Therefore, this class has a full name "context template schema manager". As a convention, it is called shortly CTS manager or schema manager. Context template schema is called shortly schema. CTS manager also manages how to load (read) and save (write) schema.
    Note, context template is template for a context, represented by the class ContextTemplate. Context includes time, location, companion, etc. associated with a user when she/he is buying, studying, etc. For example, Time is the template for time context 31/10/2015 6:45. In other words, context is an instance of context template with specific value. A set of context templates is structured as the model which is called context template schema represented by ContextTemplateSchema interface. CTS manager extends Alg interface and therefore, it is registered in system register table and identified by its name. In other words, CTS manager is an algorithm. Plugin manager presented by PluginManager interface discovers automatically it via its name at the booting time.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

      • setup

        void setup(DataConfig config)
        Setting up (initializing) CTS manager via specified configuration.
        Parameters:
        config - specified configuration.

      • getCTSchema

        ContextTemplateSchema getCTSchema()
        Retrieving the context template schema that CTS manager manages.
        Returns:
        context template schema that CTS manager manages.

      • createContextTemplateUnit

        boolean createContextTemplateUnit()
        Creating the unit for storing context templates. Unit can be a CSV file, a database table, etc.
        Returns:
        whether creating context template successfully

      • reload

        void reload()
        Reloading context template schema.

      • createContext

        Context createContext(int ctxTemplateId,
                      java.io.Serializable assignedValue)
        Creating a context from the specified template ID and the specified context value.
        Parameters:
        ctxTemplateId - specified context template identification (ID).
        assignedValue - specified value that is assigned to the returned context. Such value must be serializable.
        Returns:
        context created from the specified template ID and the specified value.

      • getContexts

        ContextList getContexts(int userId,
                        int itemId)
        Retrieving a list of contexts relevant to a specified user and a specified item.
        Parameters:
        userId - specified user identification (user ID).
        itemId - specified item identification (item ID).
        Returns:
        context list represented by ContextList relevant to a specified user and a specified item.

      • profileOf

        Profile profileOf(Context context)
        Getting Profile of each template with regard to its value ContextValue. The specified context contains such template and such value. This method is the same to profileOf(int, ContextValue)
        Parameters:
        context - specified context.
        Returns:
        profile of the specified context.

      • profileOf

        Profile profileOf(int ctxTemplateId,
                  ContextValue ctxValue)
        Getting Profile of each template with regard to its value ContextValue. Every template owns a profile table and each value ContextValue of template corresponds to a row in this table. Moreover such value is id of such row.
        Parameters:
        ctxTemplateId - specified template identification (ID).
        ctxValue - specified context value.
        Returns:
        profile of each template with regard to its value.

      • profilesOf

        Profiles profilesOf(int ctxTemplateId)
        Retrieving all profiles associating with the same template identification (ID).
        Parameters:
        ctxTemplateId - specified template ID.
        Returns:
        all profiles associating with the same template identification (ID).

      • createCTSProfiles

        CTSMultiProfiles createCTSProfiles()
        Every template owns a profile table and each value ContextValue of template corresponds to a row in this table. Each row in such template profile table is represented by Profile class. This method retrieves all profiles of all templates represented by CTSMultiProfiles class.
        Returns:
        all profiles of all templates, represented by CTSMultiProfiles class.

      • commitCTSchema

        boolean commitCTSchema()
        This method commits that the context template schema that CTS manager manages is valid in both memory and archive (file).
        Returns:
        whether the commitment is successful.

      • importCTSchema

        boolean importCTSchema(CTSManager ctsm)
        Importing context template schema from other CTS manager.
        Parameters:
        ctsm - other CTS manager.
        Returns:
        whether import successfully.

      • importCTSchema

        boolean importCTSchema(Dataset dataset)
        Importing context template schema from other dataset.
        Parameters:
        dataset - other dataset represented by Dataset class.
        Returns:
        whether import successfully

      • defaultCTSchema

        void defaultCTSchema()
        Initializing the internal context template schema and committing such schema.

      • controlPanel

        void controlPanel(java.awt.Component comp)
        Showing a graphic user interface (GUI) for controlling CTS manager. Such GUI is called CTS control panel.
        Parameters:
        comp - the component working as a parent of such CTS control panel.
